scenarioDescription:
The TOI-1259 A Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-1259 A is a star with 0.74 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.71 times its radius. It is located 385.21 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TOI-1259 A is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-1259 A system


TOI-1259 A b

TOI-1259 A b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-1259 A b is 140.238 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-1259 A b is 11.456 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TOI-1259 A b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TOI-1259 A, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-1259 A - System With 1 Exoplanet
